20th century tetrastyle portico and curving stair addition
Hillcrest Farm: 20th century tetrastyle portico and curving stair addition
20th century tetrastyle portico and curving stair addition
Became known as Verdant Lawn--High Ground--Tandem School--Rev John T Randolph Home after 1869--Dr Paul B Barringer converted it into a Sanitarium circa 1903--Percy Brown Home1925

2 Story Brick, Paired Column Portico then Tetrastyle Portico 20th century, Parapet Gable End Walls with Chimney Curtains, 3 Bay, 2 Pile, Pit Sawn Rafters, Circular Sawn Lath, Interesting Mantels with Greek Frets, Symmetrical Trim, Rondel Blocks, 4 Panel Door, 6 Panel Doors, 6/6, Splayed Windows, Fanlights, Bulls-eye Window with Stone Keystones, Blinds; Kitchen/Laundry: Flemish Bond Gable End w/7 Course American Bond Side, Mousetooth Cornice; Outbuilding: 5-7 Course American with Flemish Variant Bond
George Sidney Ford, 2 Tier Portico 1860s--Floyd Johnson, Architect 20th century
